00058 /*****************************************************************************\
00059  * NOTICE OF CONVENTION                                                      *
00060  * ------------------------------------------------------------------------- *
00061  * Mspec links to Pcode, Hcode, and Lcode modules.  In order to allow this   *
00062  * to take place without requiring front-end modules to link to liblcode.a,  *
00063  * Mspec code is divided into two classes as follows:                        *
00064  *  - mi_*.c must not depend on linkage to liblcode.a                        *
00065  *  - ml_*.c may depend on linkage to liblcode.a                             *
00066 \*****************************************************************************/
00067 
00068 /* 10/29/02 REK Adding config.h */
00069 #include <config.h>
00070 
00071 #ifdef M_BX86_FOR_HCODE
00072 #include <Hcode/h_ccode.h>
00073 #endif
00074 
00075 #include <Lcode/l_main.h>
00076 #include "m_spec.h"
00077 #include "m_bx86.h"

00080 
00081 #define M_BX86_SIZE_VOID        0
00082 #define M_BX86_SIZE_BIT         1
00083 #define M_BX86_SIZE_CHAR        8
00084 #define M_BX86_SIZE_SHORT       16
00085 #define M_BX86_SIZE_INT         32
00086 #define M_BX86_SIZE_LONG        32
00087 #define M_BX86_SIZE_FLOAT       32
00088 #define M_BX86_SIZE_DOUBLE      64
00089 #define M_BX86_SIZE_POINTER     32
00090 #define M_BX86_SIZE_UNION       -1
00091 #define M_BX86_SIZE_STRUCT      -1
00092 #define M_BX86_SIZE_BLOCK       -1
00093 #define M_BX86_SIZE_MAX         64
00094 
00095 #define M_BX86_ALIGN_VOID       -1
00096 #define M_BX86_ALIGN_BIT        1
00097 #define M_BX86_ALIGN_CHAR       8
00098 #define M_BX86_ALIGN_SHORT      16
00099 #define M_BX86_ALIGN_INT        32
00100 #define M_BX86_ALIGN_LONG       32
00101 #define M_BX86_ALIGN_FLOAT      32
00102 #define M_BX86_ALIGN_DOUBLE     32
00103 #define M_BX86_ALIGN_POINTER    32
00104 #define M_BX86_ALIGN_UNION      -1      /* depends on the field */
00105 #define M_BX86_ALIGN_STRUCT     -1
00106 #define M_BX86_ALIGN_BLOCK      -1
00107 #define M_BX86_ALIGN_MAX        64
00108 
00109 int
00110 M_bx86_type_size (int mtype)
00111 {
00112   switch (mtype)
00113     {
00114     case M_TYPE_VOID:
00115       return M_BX86_SIZE_VOID;
00116     case M_TYPE_BIT_LONG:
00117       return M_BX86_SIZE_BIT;
00118     case M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR:
00119       return M_BX86_SIZE_BIT;
00120     case M_TYPE_CHAR:
00121       return M_BX86_SIZE_CHAR;
00122     case M_TYPE_SHORT:
00123       return M_BX86_SIZE_SHORT;
00124     case M_TYPE_INT:
00125       return M_BX86_SIZE_INT;
00126     case M_TYPE_LONG:
00127       return M_BX86_SIZE_LONG;
00128     case M_TYPE_FLOAT:
00129       return M_BX86_SIZE_FLOAT;
00130     case M_TYPE_DOUBLE:
00131       return M_BX86_SIZE_DOUBLE;
00132     case M_TYPE_POINTER:
00133       return M_BX86_SIZE_POINTER;
00134     case M_TYPE_UNION:
00135       return M_BX86_SIZE_UNION;
00136     case M_TYPE_STRUCT:
00137       return M_BX86_SIZE_STRUCT;
00138     case M_TYPE_BLOCK:
00139       return M_BX86_SIZE_BLOCK;
00140     default:
00141       return -1;
00142     }
00143 }
00144 
00145 int
00146 M_bx86_type_align (int mtype)
00147 {
00148   switch (mtype)
00149     {
00150     case M_TYPE_VOID:
00151       return M_BX86_ALIGN_VOID;
00152     case M_TYPE_BIT_LONG:
00153       return M_BX86_ALIGN_BIT;
00154     case M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR:
00155       return M_BX86_ALIGN_BIT;
00156     case M_TYPE_CHAR:
00157       return M_BX86_ALIGN_CHAR;
00158     case M_TYPE_SHORT:
00159       return M_BX86_ALIGN_SHORT;
00160     case M_TYPE_INT:
00161       return M_BX86_ALIGN_INT;
00162     case M_TYPE_LONG:
00163       return M_BX86_ALIGN_LONG;
00164     case M_TYPE_FLOAT:
00165       return M_BX86_ALIGN_FLOAT;
00166     case M_TYPE_DOUBLE:
00167       return M_BX86_ALIGN_DOUBLE;
00168     case M_TYPE_POINTER:
00169       return M_BX86_ALIGN_POINTER;
00170     case M_TYPE_UNION:
00171       return M_BX86_ALIGN_UNION;
00172     case M_TYPE_STRUCT:
00173       return M_BX86_ALIGN_STRUCT;
00174     case M_TYPE_BLOCK:
00175       return M_BX86_ALIGN_BLOCK;
00176     default:
00177       return -1;
00178     }
00179 }
00180 
00181 void
00182 M_bx86_char (M_Type type, int unsign)
00183 {
00184   type->type = M_TYPE_CHAR;
00185   type->unsign = unsign;
00186   type->align = M_BX86_ALIGN_CHAR;
00187   type->size = M_BX86_SIZE_CHAR;
00188   type->nbits = M_BX86_SIZE_CHAR;
00189 }
00190 
00191 void
00192 M_bx86_short (M_Type type, int unsign)
00193 {
00194   type->type = M_TYPE_SHORT;
00195   type->unsign = unsign;
00196   type->align = M_BX86_ALIGN_SHORT;
00197   type->size = M_BX86_SIZE_SHORT;
00198   type->nbits = M_BX86_SIZE_SHORT;
00199 }
00200 
00201 void
00202 M_bx86_int (M_Type type, int unsign)
00203 {
00204   type->type = M_TYPE_INT;
00205   type->unsign = unsign;
00206   type->align = M_BX86_ALIGN_INT;
00207   type->size = M_BX86_SIZE_INT;
00208   type->nbits = M_BX86_SIZE_INT;
00209 }
00210 
00211 void
00212 M_bx86_long (M_Type type, int unsign)
00213 {
00214   type->type = M_TYPE_LONG;
00215   type->unsign = unsign;
00216   type->align = M_BX86_ALIGN_LONG;
00217   type->size = M_BX86_SIZE_LONG;
00218   type->nbits = M_BX86_SIZE_LONG;
00219 }
00220 
00221 int
00222 M_bx86_layout_order (void)
00223 {
00224   return M_LITTLE_ENDIAN;
00225 }

00227 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00228 
00229 /* From m_bx86.h:
00230   enum 
00231   {
00232     M_B_486=0,  
00233     M_B_PENTIUM,
00234     M_B_PPRO,
00235     M_B_PENTIUM_MMX,
00236     M_B_PENTIUM_II,
00237     M_B_K5,
00238     M_B_K6,
00239     M_B_K6_MMX,
00240     M_B_K6_PLUS
00241   };
00242 */
00243 
00244 void
00245 M_set_model_bx86 (char *model_name)
00246 {
00247   if (!strcasecmp (model_name, "486"))
00248     M_model = M_B_486;
00249   else if (!strcasecmp (model_name, "Pentium"))
00250     M_model = M_B_PENTIUM;
00251   else if (!strcasecmp (model_name, "Krypton") ||
00252            !strcasecmp (model_name, "K5"))
00253     M_model = M_B_K5;
00254   else if (!strcasecmp (model_name, "PPro"))
00255     M_model = M_B_PPRO;
00256   else if (!strcasecmp (model_name, "Pentium_MMX"))
00257     M_model = M_B_PENTIUM_MMX;
00258   else if (!strcasecmp (model_name, "Pentium_II"))
00259     M_model = M_B_PENTIUM_II;
00260   else if (!strcasecmp (model_name, "K6"))
00261     M_model = M_B_K6;
00262   else if (!strcasecmp (model_name, "K6_MMX"))
00263     M_model = M_B_K6_MMX;
00264   else if (!strcasecmp (model_name, "K6_Plus"))
00265     M_model = M_B_K6_PLUS;
00266   else
00267     M_assert (0, "M_set_model_bx86:  Illegal model specified!");
00268 }
